heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 28 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.4°C) and outside temperature (down 2.3°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 290 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm), cloud levels (up 197 m), feels like temperature (up 1.6°C), and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 289.9m lower than yesterday, 70.9m lower than the past week, 197.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 845m to 2560m and averaged 1114.5m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.0°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
